summary: In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, the term "solicitor" is redirected to the preferred term "public legal official." This designation encompasses professionals who provide legal services and represent clients in various legal matters. Public legal officials play a crucial role in the organization of the legal system, ensuring access to justice and upholding the rule of law. Their functions may include advising on legal rights, drafting legal documents, and representing clients in court. Understanding the role of public legal officials is essential for navigating the complexities of EU law and regulatory compliance, particularly in cross-border legal issues.
